alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 11:54AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 PM MDT... At 1153 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Pastura, or 15 miles east of Vaughn, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central De Baca and southwestern Guadalupe Counties. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 274 and 300. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
